events.name: Russia Suspends Participation in UN-Brokered Grain Export Deal
events.wd_label: Russia Suspends Participation in UN-Brokered Grain Export Deal
events.wd_description: Russia announced the suspension of its participation in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine after a drone attack on Sevastopol, Crimea, which Russia blames on Kyiv.
events.description: Russia announced the suspension of its participation in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine after a drone attack on Sevastopol, Crimea, which Russia blames on Kyiv.

events.name: Suspension of Grain Deal
events.wd_description: Russia suspended its involvement in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine, citing a drone attack on Sevastopol as the reason for its withdrawal.
events.description: Russia suspended its involvement in the UN-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine, citing a drone attack on Sevastopol as the reason for its withdrawal.

events.name: Drone Attack on Sevastopol
events.wd_description: A drone attack targeted the Crimean city of Sevastopol, which Russia attributed to Kyiv, although this claim could not be independently verified.
events.description: A drone attack targeted the Crimean city of Sevastopol, which Russia attributed to Kyiv, although this claim could not be independently verified.

events.name: Ukrainian Response
events.wd_description: Ukraine accused Russia of fabricating the attack to justify its withdrawal from the grain deal and criticized Moscow for various forms of blackmail, including nuclear and food blackmail.
events.description: Ukraine accused Russia of fabricating the attack to justify its withdrawal from the grain deal and criticized Moscow for various forms of blackmail, including nuclear and food blackmail.

events.name: Explosions at Russian Airbases Following Ukrainian Drone Strikes
events.wd_label: Explosions at Russian Airbases Following Ukrainian Drone Strikes
events.wd_description: Two Russian airbases, located far from the frontlines, were hit by explosions, apparently due to Ukrainian drone strikes targeting bombers used by Russia in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.
events.description: Two Russian airbases, located far from the frontlines, were hit by explosions, apparently due to Ukrainian drone strikes targeting bombers used by Russia in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.

events.name: Drone Strikes on Russian Airbases
events.wd_description: Ukrainian drones reportedly targeted Russian airbases, causing explosions at facilities used by bombers involved in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.
events.description: Ukrainian drones reportedly targeted Russian airbases, causing explosions at facilities used by bombers involved in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.

events.name: Damage and Casualties
events.wd_description: The explosions damaged two Russian airplanes, and another explosion at Dyagilevo military airbase resulted in three deaths and five injuries after a fuel truck exploded.
events.description: The explosions damaged two Russian airplanes, and another explosion at Dyagilevo military airbase resulted in three deaths and five injuries after a fuel truck exploded.

events.name: Kremlin's Response
events.wd_description: The Kremlin confirmed that President Vladimir Putin had been briefed on the incidents, occurring on the same day he reopened the Crimean Bridge, previously damaged in an explosion.
events.description: The Kremlin confirmed that President Vladimir Putin had been briefed on the incidents, occurring on the same day he reopened the Crimean Bridge, previously damaged in an explosion.

events.name: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_label: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.
events.description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.

events.name: Inflation Increase
events.wd_description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.
events.description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.

events.name: Energy Price Surge
events.wd_description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.
events.description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.

events.name: Economic Recession Projection
events.wd_description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.
events.description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.

events.name: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.
events.description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.

events.name: Battery Supply Chain Expansion
events.wd_description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.
events.description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.

events.name: Ultium LLC Joint Venture
events.wd_description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.
events.description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.

events.name: Impact of Inflation Reduction Act
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.

events.name: Federal Subsidies and Competitive Advantage
events.wd_description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
events.description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
